## Invariance of the MLE

For $Y_1,...,Y_n \overset{iid}{\sim} N(\mu, \sigma^2)$, we saw that the MLE of the variance is $\widehat{\sigma}^2 = \frac{1}{n} \sum \limits_{i=1}^n (Y_i - \overline{Y})^2$. What if we instead want to estimate the *standard deviation*, $\sigma$?
